definition: to swallow whole (idiom); fig. to apply uncritically
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: It's no good taking over the experience of foreign countries uncritically.
sentences.chinese: 决不可生吞活剥地搬用外国的经验。

sentences.english: I'll seek you out, flay you alive. One more word and you won't survive.
sentences.chinese: 我要找到你，生吞活剥，总而言之死路一条。

sentences.english: Are those ravens going to eat it alive ?
sentences.chinese: 那些乌鸦要把它生吞活剥了吗？

definition: to make mincemeat of sb/to hack sb to pieces (used while cursing)
to execute on the spot (idiom); summary execution/to carry out the law on the spot
to eat sb's flesh and sleep on their hide (idiom); to swear revenge on sb/implacable hatred/to have sb's guts for garters
to place sb on field of death/to confront with mortal danger/to give sb no way out/with one's back to the wall/looking death in the eye/part of idiom 置之死地而後生|置之死地而后生
to be scared out of one's wits/to scare stiff
to slaughter livestock/to govern or rule/to cheat customers/imperial official in dynastic China
jackals, wolves, tigers and panthers (idiom)/animals who are dangerous to man and cattle/fierce and cruel people
